wpPost.title: How To Get Formatted Price With Currency In Magento 2
wpPost.content:
Magento 2 is an exceptional e-commerce platform renowned for its adaptability and robustness, offering an extensive range of features to streamline online store management. Merchants can exercise complete authority over their digital stores, from managing products and customers to handling orders and shipping.

Pricing and currency management is a vital aspect of providing a seamless shopping experience to customers. Magento 2’s pricing system is flexible and dynamic, offering a custom price template feature that empowers store owners to set and regulate prices based on customer groups, products, and geographic regions. This functionality enables store owners to devise custom pricing strategies, focusing on specific customer segments, and enhancing their sales potential.

This blog post provides a detailed account of how to get formatted price with currency in Magento 2. The platform’s comprehensive set of APIs and functions simplify the process of retrieving and formatting prices to suit individual needs. With this information, store owners and developers can customize their e-commerce store, catering to their business requirements and their customers’ preferences.

Whether you are a novice or an experienced Magento 2 user, this guide equips you with the necessary tools and knowledge to manage the pricing and currency of your online store efficiently.

Methods to Get Formatted Prices with Currency in Magento 2Â 

There are two methods to achieve this, one using the Object Manager and the other using the Block class.

Method 1: Using Object Manager

The Object Manager is a central repository for all objects in Magento 2. It can be used to instantiate any object in the system, including the price helper. Here is an example of how to get the formatted price with a currency symbol using the Object Manager.

php

<?php

namespace Vendor\Module\Block;

use Magento\Framework\View\Element\Template;

class Example extends Template

{

    protected $_priceHelper;

    public function __construct(

        \Magento\Framework\View\Element\Template\Context $context,

        \Magento\Framework\Pricing\Helper\Data $priceHelper

    ) {

        $this->_priceHelper = $priceHelper;

        parent::__construct($context);

    }

    public function getFormattedPrice($price)

    {

        return $this->_priceHelper->currency($price, true, false);

    }

}

In this example, we first instantiate the price helper using the Object Manager. We then use the currency method of the price helper for formatting the price with the currency symbol. The first argument is the price, the second argument is a boolean indicating whether to include the currency symbol and the third argument is a boolean indicating whether to include the currency code.

Method 2: Using Block Class

Another way to get the formatted price with the currency symbol is to use the Block class. Here is an example of how to do that:

php

<?php

namespace Vendor\Module\Block;

use Magento\Framework\View\Element\Template;

class Example extends Template

{

    public function getFormattedPrice($price)

    {

        return $this->priceFormatter->format($price, false);

    }

}

In this example, we use the format method of the price For matter object to get the formatted price. The first argument is the price, and the second argument is a boolean indicating whether to include the currency symbol.

Conclusion

This blog post provided insights into obtaining the formatted price with currency in Magento 2. The content covered two approaches to accomplish this task – one leveraging the Object Manager and the other utilizing the Block class. These methods are simple and can be implemented based on specific needs. I trust that this blog post assisted in comprehending how to retrieve the formatted price with the currency symbol in Magento 2.
